moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 e6 3. Nf3 Bd6 4. Bg3 Bxg: I feel confortable with this. My lsb is better than his.
moves.6... Nc6: He helped a lot. But let's see...
moves.8. Nbd2: ? My Q is awakwardly placed, ready for a trap.
moves.9. e3: ? I bet he can't trap it.
moves.11. g4: ...providing my Q for a more active square and a refuge, just in case. Also controlling this Kside.
moves.11... O-O-O: Yes. My target is there. How can I get to it? Not easy! I would have gone for Qb4 at once!
moves.12. c3 Rgh8 13. Qg3 Kb8 14. Bd3 Rde8: He plans to liberate his position by playing e5. I can't allow it.
moves.15. Ne5 Ne4: Sacs a pawn. If NxN, dxN.
moves.16. Bxe4: I liked a N more than a B there.
moves.18. dxe5: Probably a mistake, but I didn't like the Q's hunt after Qxe4.
moves.18... Bb5: Clever, now I can't castle. I can't move my c pawn, or Qb4+.
moves.19... Red8 20. Nd2: Defening without exchanging or moving pawns. Be3 looks scary, but there is no inmediate threat.
moves.21. f4 Qe7 22. Nb3: The idea is Nd4. It can be kicked by the c pawn, though. No, no c4.
moves.22... Ba4 23. Qf3: Maybe was too easy: I threat Na5...
moves.23... Bxb3 24. axb3: Now I am a pawn up, with more space.
moves.24... Qc5 25. Kc2 Rd5 26. Rd4 c6 27. g5: ?? c4 is a valid fork! I thought it was impossible, I just thought about subtle manouvers on the K side... :-)
moves.28. gxh6 gxh6 29. Rh3: ...with the idea to play Rg3-Rg7... after the move, realizing the fork...
moves.29... Rxd4 30. exd4: Now my Q is dued to the defence of e2 and f1.
moves.30... Kc7 31. Rg3 Rh7 32. Rg8 a5 33. f5: This was my plan. My Q wil leave his post, but only when it would be too late... (or so I thought!)
moves.33... exf5 34. Qxf5: ...and Rh7 is lost. Can you believe I didn't take it? But let's see why!
moves.34... Qe2+ 35. Kb1 Qd1+ 36. Ka2: I though I was shielded, but...
moves.36... a4: ! Very clever! He will force a draw or a Q's exchange, saving the R! How can I save from a drawn?
moves.37. Qc8+ Kb6 38. Qd8+ Kb5 39. c4+ Ka6 40: A good, nice, old-style mate net! :-)
